titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Gabriel Endicott, Indictment
CWG5552

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Lawrence Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
Gabriel Endicott
Indictment
The Grand Jury of Lawrence County in the name and by the Authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Gabriel Endicott of the crime of murder committed as follows to wit. The said Gabriel Endicott in the first day of January ^in the year^ 1856, in Lawrence County did feloniously wilfully maliciously And of his malace aforethought Kill and Murder one David Justin by shooting him with a pistol against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

B. D. Lacy Atto for
Comth.
A True bill
David Carnutt (Foreman
Lawrence Circuit Court Oct Term 1859 1st day
The Comonwealth of Ky
against } on charge of Murder.
Gabriel Endicott

This day came the Commonwealth of Ky, and Gabriel Endicott in person and plead not guilty, and there upon came a jury to wit Bazel Rucker, J B Ward, Elijah Hurlin William Everman, James McGlinn Samuel Evermore James W Scott, John Grizza T. J. England James A Forster David M Harper & Senr W Gooding, who being aided tried and sworn to well and truly try, and true delivered
make between the Commonwealth of Kentucky and Gabriel Endicott, and having heard the arguments of Council, and afterwards the following Verdict. We the Jury find the prisoner guilty of Man Slaughter, and say he shall serve in penatentiary of Kentucky for a term of Ten years.

J. B. Ward Foreman
A Copy Attest.
R. F. Vinson clk
By H. S. Bussey D. C.
Commonwealth
vs } copy of Indictment & Jury & Judgement
Gabriel EndicottFee for copying 30Â¢For Jas. M. Rice
